dataset.title: MLPA baseline: Subtidal: Community Surveys: Fish Surveys

abstract.para: This metadata record documents the size frequency surveys for PISCO subtidal community surveys. Size frequency sampling consists of recording the number and size of target invertebrate species (urchins of the genus Strongylocentrotus and abalone of the genus Haliotis). Indivduals are encountered and recorded either as part of normal swath surveys, or during random swims anywhere within the survey site. Subtidal community structure surveys are conducted annually at all sites during the summer or early fall, and quantify substrate type and relief, benthic cover, abundance of major groups of macroalgae and invertebrates, and abundance and size of fishes. Spatial allocation of sampling is designed to measure year-to-year site-wide variability in community structure and the spatial scales at which such variation occurs. A site is defined as a fixed stretch of coastline, occupying approximately 500m. Originally, each site was divided into 2 halves (sides), each comprised of 12 transects startified across the four zones described above. Starting in 2007, many new sites were added for monitoring MPAs established by the MLPA along the coast of central California. These MLPA sites are equivalent of one "side" of the orignal PISCO sites (i.e. 12 transects).

intellectualRights.para: Please cite PISCO in all publications containing these data. The citation should take the form: "This study utilized data collected by the Partnership for Interdisciplinary Studies of Coastal Oceans: a long-term ecological consortium funded by the David and Lucile Packard Foundation and the Gordon and Betty Moore Foundation." Please send copies of any published manuscript based on these data to the PISCO Program Coordinator (http://piscoweb.org/who/coordinators). Users of these data are encouraged to contact the Principal Investigators. Where appropriate, researchers whose projects are integrally dependent on PISCO data are encouraged to consider collaboration and/or co-authorship with original PISCO investigators. Extensive efforts are made to ensure that online data are accurate and up to date, but the authors and PISCO will not take responsibility for any errors that may exist in data provided online. Furthermore, the user assumes all responsibility for errors in analysis or judgment resulting from use of the data.

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: All sites: ALL: Size Frequency surveys are conducted at discrete sites ranging from Depoe Bay, OR in the north to Anacapa Island, CA in the south. For a complete description of sites see http://piscoweb.org/research/community/subtidal

section.title: Subtidal Size Frequency Survey
section.para: Size frequency data is recorded by divers at random locations within a study site. Shell diameters (abalone) or diameter of test and spines (urchins) are measured by divers in situ. In the case of urchins sampled by UCSB in the channel islands, large numbers of individuals may be collected in bags and brought aboard the research vessel to facilitate measurement. More information can be obtained at http://piscoweb.org/research/community/subtidal

dataTable.entityName: Taxonomic lookup table for size frequency data
dataTable.entityDescription: Lookup table for the PISCO_classcode attribute which is used in all datasets and identifies the taxonomic group being described by each observation.

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique taxonomic or functional classification code that is being counted. This refers to a code that defines the Genus and Species that is identified. May also represent a broader taxonomic grouping or a limited number of species that can't be identified to individual species.

textDomain.definition: classification determined by PISCO subtidal team

attribute.attributeDefinition: scientific genus name, will be n/a for higher level groupings

textDomain.definition: conforms to genus names in ITIS database

attribute.attributeDefinition: scientific speceis name, will be n/a for higher level groupings

textDomain.definition: conforms to species names in ITIS database

attribute.attributeDefinition: common species name or description of higher taxonomic grouping

textDomain.definition: common or group taxon names as agreed by pisco subtidal team

dataTable.entityDescription: MLPA baseline Central Coast subtidal community survey size frequency data for 2007

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique code that represents the method used for either collecting or processing the samples, as defined in the PISCO method table. As procedures change in the collection or processing protocols, the dataset records will reflect the change by using a new method code.

codeDefinition.definition: Definition code that represents the size frequency survey

attribute.attributeDefinition: The year that the survey was done. This date is expressed in YYYY format. Dates reflect measurements taken in Local Time.
The month that the survey was done. This date is expressed in M or MM format. Dates reflect measurements taken in Local Time.
The day that the survey was done. This date is expressed in D or DD format. Dates reflect measurements taken in Local Time.

The unique site code where the survey was performed. (as defined in the site information table) This site code refers to a specific GPS location defined by a bounding box and is likely associated with a placename (i.e there may be multiple sitecodes at the 'Jalama Beach' placename).

textDomain.definition: Subtidal site codes as defined by the PISCO subtidal team

attribute.attributeDefinition: A division of the site into one, two, or three areas, referred to as sides.

codeDefinition.definition: indicates central side of the site or a site with only one side
an extra west side to one site (UCSB only)

attribute.attributeDefinition: A division of the side into 2 to 4 categories representing onshore-offshore stratification or targeted bottom depths for transects.

codeDefinition.definition: outer zone within side- target depth 20m
middle zone within side- target depth 12.5m

attribute.attributeDefinition: A number representing one of the parallel transects through the study area, along which the sampling segments are located.

textDomain.definition: arbitrary designation of transect within zone

attribute.attributeDefinition: The unique taxonomic or functional classification code that is being counted. This refers to a code that defines the Genus and Species that is identified. May also represent a broader taxonomic grouping or a limited number of species that can't be identified to individual species.

textDomain.definition: species code as defined in the PISCO classification table

attribute.attributeDefinition: The total number of individuals of a given classcode and size.
Average depth of the transect estimated by the diver. Depth is measured at each level.
The primary diver collecting data on the transect.

textDomain.definition: The name (first, last) or inititals (first, last) of the diver

attribute.attributeDefinition: Free text notes taken at the time of the sample, or added at the time of data entry.

textDomain.definition: Free text notes taken at the time of the sample, or added at the time of data entry.
